page.title: 02Uyeasound Up Helly Aa.
page.content: Up Helly Aa is a fire festival which is usually held in January or February.This festival is held to celebrate the end of winter.Up Helly Aa is held all over Shetland but the biggest festival is held in Lerwick. The first Uyeasound Up Helly Aa was held in 1911 when there were 20 assorted guizers. Guizers are people who dress up and take part in the celebration. With a dwindling population in South Unst during the 1930's, Up Helly Aa became a smaller celebration until the whole of Unst joined in. In 1985 there was a new galley which was followed in the procession by 24 squads of guizers carrying lighted torches.After the bonfire,the guizers performed their acts in the Village Hall and dancing continued all night.
